perturbation.changed_text: 18.2 IN ANY DISPUTE BETWEEN THE PARTIES, ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT, ANY BREACH OF THIS AGREEMENT, OR THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE PARTIES, WHETHER SOUNDING IN CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ALL PARTIES WAIVE ANY RIGHT THEY. perturbation.explanation: The clause 'NOTHING IN THIS SECTION LIMITS OUR RIGHT OR THE RIGHT OF AN INDEMNIFIED PARTY TO BE INDEMNIFIED AGAINST THE PAYMENT OF PUNITIVE OR EXEMPLARY DAMAGES TO A THIRD PARTY' has been removed. It limits the waiver of punitive damages by ensuring the indemnified party can still seek indemnity against payment of such damages to a third party. Its omission may violate general principles of indemnity law that seek to make an injured party whole, thereby creating a legal risk. Without this clause, the franchisee might argue that because they've waived punitive damages, they're also not liable for indemnifying the franchisor against punitive damages awarded to a third party, regardless of the origin of the claim.

perturbation.original_text: 17.14 Attorneys' Fees and Costs. If either Party is required to employ legal counsel or to incur other expenses to enforce any provision of this Agreement or defend any claim by the other, then the prevailing party in any resulting dispute will be entitled to recover from the non- prevailing party the amount of all reasonable fees of attorneys and experts, court costs, and all other expenses incurred in enforcing such obligation or in defending against such claim, demand, action, or proceeding.
perturbation.changed_text: 17.14 Attorneys' Fees and Costs. If either Party is required to employ legal counsel or to incur other expenses to enforce any provision of this Agreement or defend any claim by the other, then the prevailing party in any resulting dispute will be entitled to recover reasonable fees of attorneys and experts.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates that 'the prevailing party... recover from the non-prevailing party... all other expenses incurred in enforcing such obligation or in defending against such claim, demand, action, or proceeding.' This has been weakened by excluding the reference to the non-prevailing party reimbursing for court costs and all other expenses, which may cause non-compliance with some jurisdiction's franchise laws regarding dispute resolution and cost allocation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Franchise laws regarding dispute resolution costs
